title: How to peel sweet corn easily | How to remove corn kernels in 1 minute | Peeling Trick |Simple Trick

subtasks: Grab a spoon
Take out the first row of kernels
Push the kernels out after the first row
Take out subsequent rows easily
Store the extracted kernels in the freezer for up to 50 days
Eat the raw extracted corn kernel directly
Remove corn kernels from freezer

tasks.task: Transcript details the process of extracting corn kernels, which is a farming/husbandry task. MAINTASKs are broken down into subtasks related to kernel extraction, storage, and consumption.

subtasks: Grab a spoon
Take out the first row of kernels
Push the kernels out after the first row
Take out subsequent rows easily
Store the extracted kernels in the freezer for up to 50 days
Eat the raw extracted corn kernel directly
Remove corn kernels from freezer
Let kernels thaw to desired consistency
Prepare corn on the cob
Cook corn using preferred method (optional step)
** Grab a spoon
** Take out the first row of kernels (note: this row may need a bit more pressure)
** Continue pushing the kernels out after the first row is extracted
** Extract subsequent rows, which become easier once the initial rows are removed
** Store the extracted kernels in the freezer (they can last up to 50 days when stored frozen)
** Enjoy the corn kernels either raw or cooked, which is noted as being very sweet
** Remove the frozen kernels from the freezer
** Allow them to thaw to the desired consistency before use
** Prepare the corn on the cob (if using fresh)
** Cook using the preferred method (though this is optional as the kernels can also be eaten raw)
